title: No One (2005 film)
text:
No One () is a Mexican <a href="documentary%20film">documentary film</a> by <a href="Tin%20Dirdamal">Tin Dirdamal</a> on the impoverished <a href="Central%20American">Central American</a>s who leave their countries in hope of a better life in the United States. It premiered in 2005 and was shown at different international film festivals, winning the <a href="Sundance%20Film%20Festival">Sundance Film Festival</a> audience award for World Documentary in 2006.
The film follows a number of <a href="refugee">refugee</a>s who have to cross Mexico, about 4,000 kilometers, before reaching the US border. On their way through Mexico they put their remaining money, dignity, health and life on the line.
The soundtrack was written by Mexican composer Alfonso M.
